data.text: @thenewbrunette That's one of the reasons the Academy is fumbling around trying to rejig its best film categories, as the objectively good and the popular are increasingly disparate categories.

@thenewbrunette They're quite similar movies in loads of ways. Both were relatively low-budget flicks. The kinda awards-baiting dramas studios like to have come Oscar time. Disagree re the casting/box office issue tho. These films simply don't have mass cinema appeal any more.
JC has cornered the market in "hard-nosed professional who comes a cropper" kinda roles. Molly's Game is the better movie, though both are overlong and have awkward third acts.
